p: In this screening work, the crude methanolic extract produced considerable zone of inhibition for Gram positive (+) S. aureus (15 mm in 1000 µg/ml) and Gram negative (-) E. coli (13 mm in 1000 µg/ml) when compared to the standard tetracycline (30 mm and 22 mm, respectively). Surprisingly, it did not produce any kind of antimicrobial properties against Gram positive (+) B. subtilis (Table 4).
